== Customizing the Home Screen ==

The information on the Home screen can be filtered so that any combination of the following types of information are displayed:

  • Favorites
  • Recent Lists
  • Labels
  • Recent Documents

By default, all four types of information are displayed.

To change the types of information you want displayed on the Home screen, tap the gear icon.

[[image:Customizing-the-Home-Screen.png]]

The Tools screen opens.

[[image:F436D2AD-6065-40B1-B317-2E734ACD22AC.png]]

For each of the sections, you can tap the Show section to toggle that section on and off. Each of the sections also contain options for limiting the number of items shown and enabling or disabling horizontal scrolling, where applicable.

== Managing Favorites ==

You can add any list, record, module, or [stream] to the Favorites section of the home screen. The items you have added to the Favorites section display as [labels]. Use the favorites for quick access to the items that you use most often.

To add an item to the favorites section:

  1. Navigate to the screen that you want to add as a favorite to the home screen.
  2. Tap and hold the Home Icon.
    [[image:Managing-Favorites.png]]
    The Save Favorite to Home Page dialog box opens.
  3. Give the favorite a name, assign its label a color and icon, and tap Save.
    [[image:DB3FA08C-7405-4D9F-B06F-C4426EAA8653.png]]

To change or remove a favorite:

  1. On the Home screen, tap the Favorites section heading.
    The labels for your favorites are displayed.
  2. Locate the favorite you want to change, and tap and hold the label until the Save Favorite to Home Page dialog box opens.
  3. Change the name, color, or icon as needed and tap Save.
  4. To remove the favorite from the Home screen, tap the trash can button.
    [[image:0214ADAF-1C76-4E34-966F-0EBD09534402.png]]

== Assigning a Tag to a Record ==
  1. Navigate to a record that you want to assign a tag to, such as an incident record.
  2. Tap the More icon in the lower right-hand corner of the screen and select tags.
    [[image:Assigning-a-Label-to-a-Record.png]]
  3. In the Tags screen, tap the tag to want to assign to this record.
    Notice that a checkmark appears on the tag.
    [[image:655C1C19-37A5-48E0-AC98-F5688FA2BAED.png]]
  4. If needed, you can tap the tag again to deselect it. You can also select multiple tags for the record.
  5. When you are finished, simply navigate away from the screen. Your tag selections are automatically saved.

== Using the Application Navigator ==

To open the application navigator, tap the application navigator icon on the top-left side of the interface.

[[image:Using-the-Application-Navigator.png]]

Scroll the navigator up or down using one or two fingers. To expand an application, tap the application name. To hide the navigator, click the application navigator icon again.

[[image:ECAB8F2C-FB09-44F0-8319-7E12FA884FB0.png]]

== Defining Tags ==

To help group and organize records, users can create tags and add them to specific records. You could create a tag called High Priority ABC and assign that label to critical incidents submitted by an important customer. Tags can be defined with an icon and color for easy identification. With a single tap, a user could then locate all critical incidents logged by ABC Corporation. Users can add as many tags as needed to any record.

Creating a New Tag

  1. On the Home screen, tap the Tags section heading. You can also tap My Tags on the application navigator.
    Previously-defined tags (if any) are displayed. Notice the number 1 in the High Priority tag. This indicates that one record has been assigned this tag.
    [[image:6D353697-817E-42AD-A6AA-9C064B6B9FC2.png]]
  2. Tap in the Create or search labels field and type the name of the tag you want to create. As you type, the new tag appears below the field.
    [[image:7C310877-20FB-421D-9909-997EF0BBCB04.png]]
  3. When you are finished, tap Done.
    [[image:E50ABD44-319A-499E-B47A-55DB1AB29B38.png]]
  4. Select a color and icon for the new tag, and tap Save.
    [[image:AD24ED42-7615-4A11-87E4-2A6DDB817C36.png]]

== Viewing Journal Streams ==

A journal stream is a real-time, sequential display of journal field entries, such as comments and work notes, from a group of records. You can, for example, view a stream of incident work notes. The stream automatically aggregates all of the journal field entries from incidents and displays them, starting with the most recently created record.

  1. Navigate to a list screen that contains journal fields.
  2. Tap the Stream icon. If no journal entries have been created for the type of records you are viewing, the Stream icon will not be displayed.
    [[image:Viewing-Journal-Streams.png]]
    Comments and work notes for the incidents display, starting with the most recent.
    [[image:38846343-42D9-4F4E-8777-19787DBA7A1E.png]]

== Accessing Records That Have Labels ==

The Labels section on the Home screen shows the labels you have defined and each label shows the number of records assigned to them.

  1. Tap the label to display records that have been assigned that label.
    The screen shows the records with that label. Note that they are not necessarily the same kind of records. In the example below, the first record is an approval and the second is an incident.
  2. The records can be sorted by either the date of creation or update by tapping the buttons at the top of the screen.
    [[image:Accessing-Records-That-Have-Labels.png]]

== Overview ==

The mobile interface supports many of the features found in the ServiceNow browser interface, including:

  • Lists
  • Forms
  • Navigation pane
  • Filtering

Additionally, several UI changes that affect how users perform important actions have been implemented. These include:

  • Tags and Favorites on the home page.
  • Memory of recent selections, lists, and documents.
  • Journal streams.

== Removing Tags from Records ==
  1. Navigate to the record from which you want to remove a tag.
  2. Tap inside the record.
  3. Tap the More icon and select Tags.
  4. Tap the tag you want to remove from the record. The checkmark disappers to indicate that the tag has been removed.

Viewing Recently Accessed Documents

The Recent Documents section of the Home screen provides an at-a-glance summary of recently accessed records. This feature allows you to avoid tapping through the application navigator to access a record that you need frequently or a record you have just viewed. To view details of one of the recently viewed documents, simply tap the record.

== Adding ServiceNow to the Home Screen ==
  1. Navigate to a page that you want to access as a shortcut, such as a list of open incidents.
  2. Tap the sharing icon at the bottom of the Safari browser.
    [[image:Adding-ServiceNow-to-the-Home-Screen.png]]
  3. Tap the ServiceNow Add to Home Screen icon.
    [[image:7C1A05E0-F8B4-435B-9C0B-C8C11AAA0B5B.png]]
  4. Type a descriptive name for the page and tap Add. The shortcut is saved to your device.
    [[image:BA4ACF5F-883B-4C46-BF9F-D0C175537FA8.png]]
    [[image:5837646D-4201-4F3A-A2E5-1EA5B8A017C9.png]]

== Accessing an Instance ==

On a mobile device that meets the mobile device support requirements, access the standard URL of an instance. The ServiceNow instance automatically detects the device and redirects to the mobile device interface by appending $m.do to the end of the URL. Accessing one interface (mobile, tablet, or desktop) does not prevent the user from accessing any of the other interfaces.

[[image:Accessing-an-Instance.png]]

== Recently Accessed Lists ==

The Recent Lists section of the Home screen shows the most recent lists you have viewed and record selections you have made. This makes it easy, for example, to return to a list of Priority 1 incidents with a single tap. Or you can return to a particular user's record that you performed some action on recently.

Whenever you view a particular list or make a selection, the system remembers it and displays it in the Recent Lists section of the Home screen and records how long ago you viewed it. To view the details of the list or selection, simply tap the row you are interested in.

Modifying a Recently Accessed List

  1. Tap on the recently-viewed list you want to modify.
    [[image:08C4AAB8-434F-47A2-9650-41B8AD706580.png]]
    The list opens in the module form which you viewed it. In the example, the list opens in Incident.
  2. Tap the filter.
    [[image:C7D63AC7-8369-4E38-AE4A-B6E6A9C220EE.png]]
    The filter editor opens.
    [[image:A9685335-4A47-4A8E-BEEC-9DE558F0C4DB.png]]
    The Filter Editor shows the current filter and lists the other available conditions that can be added to the filter.
  3. To delete one of the conditions, tap the X adjacent to that condition.
  4. To add a condition, tap it.
    The resulting screen depends on the type of condition. If you tap a text field, such as Short Description, you are presented with a text field. If you tap a conditional field, such as Category, you are presented with a list of available operators. So you can select, for example: Category - is not - Software.
  5. When you are finished defining the filter, tap Run.
